metadata.title: CVE-2019-19624 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read was discovered in OpenCV before 4.1.1. Specifically,variable coarsest_scale is assumed to be greater than or equal tofinest_scale within the calc()/ocl_calc() functions in dis_flow.cpp.However, this is not true when dealing with small images, leading to anout-of-bounds read of the heap-allocated arrays Ux and Uy.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19624` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopencv-calib3d406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-contrib406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-core406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-dnn406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-features2d406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-flann406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-highgui406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgcodecs406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-imgproc406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-java - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-ml406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-objdetect406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-photo406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-shape406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-stitching406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-superres406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-video406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-videoio406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-videostab406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv-viz406 - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
libopencv406-jni - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
opencv-data - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
python3-opencv - 4.1.2+dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: opencv package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.2+dfsg-5').
